fields.name: Abusive Content
fields.description: Content that is harmful or offensive, such as hate speech, harassment, or explicit material, often in violation of terms of service.

fields.name: Malicious Code
fields.description: Any software intentionally designed to cause harm, such as viruses, trojans, worms, and spyware, which can disrupt systems or steal data.

fields.name: Information Gathering
fields.description: Activities aimed at collecting information from systems or networks, typically as part of reconnaissance for further attacks, including scanning or probing.

fields.name: Intrusion Attempts
fields.description: Unsuccessful attempts to bypass security controls to gain unauthorized access to systems or data, often identified by intrusion detection systems (IDS).

fields.name: Intrusions
fields.description: Confirmed breaches where unauthorized entities have gained access to sensitive systems or data, possibly resulting in data theft or system compromise.

fields.name: Availability
fields.description: Incidents that affect the availability of services or resources, such as Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks or hardware failures.

fields.name: Information Content Security
fields.description: Incidents involving unauthorized access or exposure of sensitive information, including data breaches and leaks, where confidentiality is compromised.

fields.name: Fraud
fields.description: Incidents involving deceptive activities with the intention of financial gain, such as identity theft, phishing, or payment fraud.

fields.name: Vulnerable
fields.description: Known weaknesses or flaws in software, hardware, or configurations that could be exploited to compromise system integrity, confidentiality, or availability.

fields.name: Other
fields.description: Incidents or issues that do not fit into other predefined categories but still pose a risk or require attention.

fields.name: Test
fields.description: Testing scenarios or events created for simulation, practice, or evaluating system performance under potential security incidents.

fields.name: Spam
fields.description: Unsolicited or irrelevant messages sent over the internet, typically to a large number of users, often for advertising purposes.

fields.name: Harmful Speech
fields.description: Speech that incites violence, hatred, or discrimination against individuals or groups, potentially causing harm.

fields.name: Child/Sexual/Violence
fields.description: Content that involves or depicts child exploitation, sexual violence, or other forms of abusive behavior.

fields.name: Defacement
fields.description: Unauthorized alteration or vandalism of websites or digital content to deface or damage the appearance or integrity.

fields.name: Virus
fields.description: A host has been infected with malicious software that attaches itself to other programs or files and spreads to other systems, potentially causing damage.

fields.name: Worm
fields.description: A host has been compromised by a standalone malicious program that replicates itself to spread to other systems, often exploiting network vulnerabilities.

fields.name: Trojan
fields.description: A host has been infected with malware disguised as legitimate software, designed to give unauthorized access or control over the system.

fields.name: Spyware
fields.description: A host has been infected with software designed to gather information about the user or system without their knowledge, often for malicious purposes.

fields.name: Dialler
fields.description: A host has been affected by malware that automatically dials premium-rate phone numbers or services, incurring costs for the user.

fields.name: Rootkit
fields.description: A host has been compromised by a type of malware designed to gain unauthorized access while hiding its presence from detection.

fields.name: Malware
fields.description: A host has been infected with software intended to damage, disrupt, or gain unauthorized access to the system.

fields.name: Botnet
fields.description: A network of compromised hosts controlled by an attacker to perform malicious activities, such as DDoS attacks.

fields.name: Miner
fields.description: A host has been infected with malware designed to use the system's resources to mine cryptocurrency without the user's consent.

fields.name: Mining Pool Server
fields.description: A server involved in cryptocurrency mining pools that coordinates the mining activities of multiple compromised hosts.

fields.name: Scanning
fields.description: The process of systematically probing a network or system to identify vulnerabilities or gather information.

fields.name: Sniffing
fields.description: Intercepting and analyzing network traffic to capture sensitive data or monitor network activity.

fields.name: Social Engineering
fields.description: Manipulating individuals into divulging confidential information or performing actions that compromise security.

fields.name: Exploiting known vulnerabilities
fields.description: Attempting to exploit identified weaknesses in systems or software to gain unauthorized access or control.

fields.name: Login Attempts
fields.description: Repeated attempts to log into a system using various credentials, often part of a brute-force attack.

fields.name: New Attack Signature
fields.description: The introduction of a new pattern or technique used in attacks that is not yet recognized by existing defenses.

fields.name: Privileged Account Compromise
fields.description: Unauthorized access to or misuse of accounts with elevated permissions or administrative privileges.

fields.name: Unprivileged Account Compromise
fields.description: Unauthorized access to accounts with limited permissions, which may still lead to significant impacts or further attacks.

fields.name: Application Compromise
fields.description: The compromise of an applicationâ€™s security, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data loss.

fields.name: Bot
fields.description: Automated software or script used to perform repetitive tasks, often maliciously to automate attacks or conduct fraud.

fields.name: DoS
fields.description: Denial of Service attacks that overwhelm a system's resources to render it unavailable to users.

fields.name: DDoS
fields.description: Distributed Denial of Service attacks that use multiple systems to flood a target with traffic, disrupting its services.

fields.name: Sabotage
fields.description: Intentional disruption or destruction of systems or data, typically performed by insiders or external attackers.

fields.name: Outage (no malice)
fields.description: System outages caused by accidental events or failures without malicious intent, such as hardware malfunctions.

fields.name: Unauthorised access to information
fields.description: Accessing information without proper authorization, which can lead to data breaches and privacy violations.

fields.name: Unauthorised modification of information
fields.description: Unauthorized changes to information that can lead to data corruption or loss of integrity.

fields.name: Unauthorized use of resources
fields.description: Using resources without proper authorization, which may lead to financial loss or service disruption.

fields.name: Copyright
fields.description: Violation of copyright laws by unauthorized use or distribution of copyrighted material.

fields.name: Masquerade
fields.description: Impersonation of legitimate entities or individuals to deceive users or systems.

fields.name: Phishing
fields.description: Deceptive attempts to obtain sensitive information from individuals by masquerading as a trustworthy entity.

fields.name: Open For Abuse
fields.description: Systems or resources that are inadequately protected and susceptible to exploitation or abuse.
